name: Mixer Mono
description: This algorithm is a mono mixer - it mixes mono inputs to a mono output. Up to four aux send busses are available, which can be switched to pre- or post-fade.
gui_description: The display shows level meters for each channel with a thin line at the top indicating 0dBFS. If a channel exceeds this, a clip indicator (small rectangle over the 0dBFS line) appears. Chevrons to the right of the level meters indicate mixer gains. Mute and Solo are marked by 'M' and 'S', respectively, with muted channels grayed out.

parameters.name: Duplicate_output
parameters.description: An optional duplicate output. Convenient if you want to drive a stereo bus from a mono mix.

parameters.name: Channel_name_per_channel
parameters.description: A text name for the channel for identification.

input_ports.name: Input_per_channel
input_ports.description: The channel input bus for each mono mixer channel.

output_ports.name: Output
output_ports.description: The primary mono output bus of the mixer.

output_ports.name: Duplicate_output
output_ports.description: An optional secondary mono output bus, which can be used to drive a stereo bus from a mono mix.
